section.title:
inventory history by class code
class codes inventory history details for Inventory History by Class Code
section.para: To view Inventory history by Class Code, select the "Inventory History by Class Code" option. The following screen will appear:

tip.para: If a line displays in orange, this means the Item Site in question is frozen. Accurate Quantity on Hand information will not be shown until the Item Site is thawed.

section.para: When displaying Inventory history by Class Code, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Select to display Inventory history for all Class Codes.
Specify Class Code whose Inventory history you want to display.
Enter a Class Code pattern to select a range of Class Codes. Refine your search using Regular Expressions, as described in .
Select one of the available transaction types:
Displays receipts into Inventory from Manufacturing, purchases, or miscellaneous receipts.
Displays issues from Inventory to Manufacturing.
Displays Inter-Warehouse Transfers and Location and Lot/Serial Number reassignments.

note.para: The system prefixes Order Numbers with letters indicating the Order type. For example, Work Orders are prefixed with "WO", Purchase Orders with "PO", and Sales Orders with "SO". These letters are for display purposes only and are not considered part of the Order Number.

listitem.para: Select to display Inventory history by Class Code for all Warehouses.
Specify Warehouse whose Inventory history by Class Code you want to display.
This is a required field. Inventory transactions conducted on and after this date will be displayed. Start date and end date must be entered for calculation to proceed.
This is a required field. Inventory transactions conducted on and before this date will be displayed. Start date and end date must be entered for calculation to proceed.
Display lists Inventory history by Class Code, using the specified parameters.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen, returning you to the application desktop.
Select to generate the display, using the specified parameters. Start date and end date must be entered for calculation to proceed. Results will be displayed in the "Inventory History" list.
Runs the report associated with this screen.

section.para: Right-clicking on a transaction in the Inventory History list enables you to select from the following menu options:

When editing transaction information, you may choose to exclude a transaction from Inventory analysis. Not including a transaction in this manner means the following Inventory analyses will ignore the transaction: Item Usage Statistics displays, Update Reorder Levels, and Update Order Up To Levels.
If the Order Number is associated with a Work Order, the following additional menu option will also be available:
